item.title: About
item.description: I am a postdoctoral researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at University of Milano-Bicocca (Milan, Italy), working under the supervision of Prof. Bernardo Nipoti (DEMS, University of Milano-Bicocca). I have received my PhD degree in Statistics at Universiy of Padova (Padova, Italy) in 2022 under the supervision of Prof. Antonio Canale (Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padova) and Prof. Michele Guindani (Department of Statistics, UCI).

item.title: Conference presentations
item.description: Poster presentation: “Clustering activation patterns of spatially-referenced neurons”; ISBA 2022, Montreal, Canada; June 27 – July 1, 2022. Invited talk: “Bayesian nonparametric clustering of spatially-referenced spike train data”; SIS 2022, Caserta, Italy; June 22 – 24, 2022. Discussant at the solicited session “Bayesian inference for complex random structures”; SIS 2022, Caserta, Italy; June 22 – 24, 2022. Contributed talk: “Bayesian nonparametric analysis for the detection of spikes in noisy calcium imaging data”; JSM 2021; August 8 – 12, 2021.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Current position Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS), University of Milano-Bicocca. Education PhD student in Statistical Science 10/2018 – 11/2021, University of Padova. Thesis title: Bayesian modeling of calcium imaging data. Supervisor: Prof. Antonio Canale. Co-supervisor: Prof. Michele Guindani. Master’s Degree in Statistics 10/2015 – 11/2017, University of Padova.
